embeds.title: Infinite Beams
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

At the start of each turn, gain a Minor Beam. (+.)

messages.content: 4 copies of infinite beams
jesus
Uncountably Infinite Beams
collector bonus

Yeah this is a really *interesting* design space. Take functions, something that can already combine block, damage, and utility into one card, and then just give you way more damage/block for using these already strong cards.
Oh you just formed and made a 20 damage 7 block 1 cost card and played it? Here, have an extra 12 damage and block on top.
It takes the dominant strategy and just makes it way way better
I play almost the exact same way with or without it (except I might take slightly more block without it)
Functions already have the problem of being massively over-statted. This exacerbates the issue.

I really dislike this card, because it's just such a dominant design. The effect covers both scaling defense and offense, and it essentially asks absolutely nothing of you to get it. Sure, you can make it better/faster by playing with infinite beams, virus, or just stuffing your deck full of cheap encode cards, but you are already heavily incentivized to do that anyway. I can't think of almost a single situation where I wouldn't take this over the other options from a boss rare card reward screen. And sure, there are other cards from the base game that are extremely powerful and snap picks as well (feel no pain, offering, well laid plan, adrenaline, wraith form, defragment, biased cognition, rushdown, mental fortress, talk to the hand, vault, scrawl, fear no evil). The issue is that those most of those cards are very strong at 1 or 2 specific elements of the game, or are 1 shot effects that can give you very powerful single turns, but are worse in longer scaling fights. Summon orb is insanely powerful in basically everything but incredibly short act 1 fights like gremlin nob, cultist, or gremlin gang. It's too much of a 1 card solution to the entire run, providing scaling, offense, defense, and being very easy to trigger multiple times per turn. It even gets an insane upgrade providing a +2 to the block and damage for every single function created or played.

Even the one thing that powers are supposed to be bad at (providing immediate impact on the turn you draw/play them) summon orb manages to get around. If you can complete/play a function on the same turn you play summon orb, you get immediate benefit, and that's fairly easy to do once you have the 4th energy, or with buggy mess and replicate. This design just leaves very little room for interesting deckbuilding decisions, and overshadows a lot of other rares/playstyles for automaton. I would really like this to get nerfed/redesigned in a major way. At the very least it shouldn't give both block and damage.

messages.content: Well back to this card, tbh I don't see how this concept could work unless you just completely scrap either the block or attack, but even then I don't like it.
summon orb form idk
Like 99% of auto builds use a lot of functions, whether you create and play 5 in a turn or creating a few powerful ones, this just will activate no matter what.
leaning into high risk high reward could work well
Unless you want it to be a thousand cuts / after image type card, but I don't think the character has the draw/0 costs for that to work
*infinite beams*
auto has the 0 costs for a 1k cuts-like to work
I do think that encoding as a whole is a little too strong, so depending on if/how it gets reworked the concept might work
or at least enough 0 costs for Cuboid Consumer to make a 1k Cuts-like work
Not really. Silent has a ton, as well as shivs. It's not even close.
And thousand cuts isn't even that good in the first place on silent.

I really think that it should be reworked to fill less roles as a card. It just does too much, scaling your offense and defense, all while asking nothing of you. I would start by trying a version that only gives block, or only gives damage. 

The other issue is that powers often incentivize the player to change the way they would build their deck in interesting ways, helping to create build diversity between runs. Summon orb is extremely powerful, and does the exact opposite. In encourages you to build the exact same way you are already were, and supports an already very dominant playstyle. Maybe it could be reworked to support the bug archetype at rare instead. Every time you draw a status, gain X block. Like a shadow cloak variant?
I think if there was a reverse, where you gain like 10 block/damage if you didn't play a function each turn.
Functions are extremely efficient, so it could lead you to not want to use them in exchange for getting free block/damage while you assemble more
Also means the one that gives functions retain would synergize really well, since the unplayed functions won't discard themselves
It could do well as a block engine in status decks.

I do think functions need a rework, and someone presented an idea that I really liked. Encode cards don't encode themselves, but instead creates and encode copies of themselves. Functions are made the same way but exhaust on use.
This way functions can still be very strong mechanically, but don't become most of your draw pile and aren't repeatedly usable.
I like the idea of functions. Just don't let them be permanent fixtures for the fight.
I don't remember who's idea it was, and I'm pretty sure I tweaked their ideas slightly, but the idea still stands.
Wait it’s when played *and* when created?
That’s way too good
Almost a dash+ just for doing automaton things
